intro: Disperma kilimandscharicum, commonly known as the Kilimanjaro daisy, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. The plant typically grows in rocky and grassy habitats at elevations above 2,000 meters. Its flowers bloom during the dry season, and it is adapted to the harsh climatic conditions of its native environment. Disperma kilimandscharicum is often found in the vicinity of Mount Kilimanjaro and other mountainous regions in Tanzania and Kenya.
